intro: Octomeria subcallosa, commonly known as the woolly octomeria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Octomeria subcallosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
